When I was trying this site out, there were few real reviews that were helpful. Hopefully this one alleviates some folks' concerns. I worked on several sites last night from 1:30am or so until about 3am and finally decided on this one. They ask in depth questions and allow you to write in your input about the reasons you feel you need an ESA. For me, this was excellent as I wanted to make sure the person reviewing this had the truth from me. At around 2:30am or so I realised I forgot to add a crucial part of my address in and replied to the email sent to me, expecting a Do Not Reply automatic response. Barely 5 minutes later, someone answered that it'd been changed for me. Skip to today. I paid extra to have my order reviewed faster and by the time it was 10:30am I had gone to a shelter to look at a dog to adopt and needed to have some questions concretely answered. Emailed them again asking for a call, and about 10 minutes later someone called me to let me know my PDF papers were emailed to me and the gentleman answered my questions patiently and sat for a good 20 minutes explaining the anxious details to me, even giving me verbiage to give to my apartment. I promptly forgot this and opted to email them my PDF file as I don't have the actual paperwork yet. He gave me information on the person who reviewed and approved my case and I was pleased to find that the lady was actually licensed in my state. They encourage you to call back with any questions or concerns and let you know to call back if you need to change anything, such as adding airplane forms to your order later down the road. I also managed to find a coupon online for this which knocked the price down some for me which was excellent. I've already recommended this site to another friend who was questioning me about what site I did use because of the excellent customer service I've received so far and how much they alleviated my anxieties about this entire process of possible confrontation with my landlords and whatnot. So far, so good. I hope this helps.
